member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.CnxBiPad8
member.summary:
The CNX-BIPAD8 is a 24 x 8 stereo audio switcher and preamplifier, providing distribution of 16 stereo audio sources and 8 room inputs to any of 8 room outputs.
The CNX-BIPAD8 provides the following connectors.
16 RCA line-level stereo inputs (L/R) plus loop-through.
8 RCA outputs with built-in volume/tone/loudness preamplifiers and mute relays.
8 CAT5 bidirectional inputs/outputs for connection to Crestron Room Solution Boxes and/or digital audio processors.

member.summary: Property to set the format for temperature reporting. When false, the format is set to Celsius; when true, Fahrenheit.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.CommercialAmplifier.TemperatureFormatFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate the temperature format. The property is true for as long as the format is set to Fahrenheit. When the property value is false, this indicates that the format is set to Celsius.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.CommercialAmplifier.EnableTemperatureReporting
member.summary: Property to enable/disable temperature reporting. Default value is 'true'. true = enable temperature reporting; false = disable temperature reporting

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.CommercialAmplifier.TemperatureReportingEnabledFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate if the temperature reporting is enabled or disabled. The property remains true for as long as property value is true; when false, this indicates that temperature reporting is disabled.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.CommercialAmplifier.FrontPanelBrightness
member.summary: Property to set the front panel display brightness. Valid values range from 0% (minimum brightness) to 100% (maximum brightness). Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.CommercialAmplifier.FrontPanelBrightnessFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the current front panel display brightness. Valid values range from 0% (minimum brightness) to 100% (maximum brightness). Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.CommercialAmplifier.TemperatureFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the overall temperature, when property value is true. The temperature is reported in degrees Fahrenheit when property value is true, and in degrees Celsius when property value is false. The property value range is from 0 to 2570 where 1 = 0.1 degree, so the property value received for temperature 125 degrees is 1250. Valid temperature range is 0 to 125 degree Celsius, or 32 to 257 degree Fahrenheit.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.CommercialAmplifier.PresetResultFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the error code returned as a result of setting a preset.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.DspMixerBase.TemperatureFormatFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates the temperature format. The property is true for as long as the format is set to Fahrenheit. When the property is false, this indicates that the format is set to Celcius. EventIds: will trigger to indicate change.
The event will trigger for this.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.DspMixerBase.TemperatureReportingFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates if the temperature reporting is enabled or disabled. The property remains true for as long as = true; when false, this indicates that temperature reporting is disabled. EventIds: will trigger to indicate change.
The event will trigger for this.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.DspMixerBase.TemperatureFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the overall temperature, when temperature reporting is enabled. The temperature is reported in degrees Fahrenheit when = true, and in degrees Celsius when = false. The range is from 0d to 2550d where 1d = 0.1 degree. Range of temperature is (0 to 125 degree Celcius, or 32 to 257 degree Fahrenheit) EventIds: will trigger to indicate change.
The event will trigger for this.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.DspMixerBase.PresetResultFeedback

member.summary:
Property to get the current front panel display brightness. Valid values range from 0% (minimum brightness) to 100% (maximum brightness). member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.C2nAmp.TemperatureFormatFeedback
member.summary: Indicates the temperature format. EventIds: TemperatureFormatFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.
member.remarks: True = Format is Celsius ; False = Format is Fahrenheit.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.C2nAmp.TemperatureReportingEnableFeedback
member.summary: Indicates the status of temperature reporting. EventIds: TemperatureReportingEnableFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.
member.remarks: True = Temp reporting enabled; False = Temp reporting disabled.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.C2nAmp.AmpFaultFeedback
member.summary: Indicates a fault condition in the system. EventIds: AmpFaultFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.
member.remarks: True = Fault condition; False = No fault.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.C2nAmp.TemperatureFaultFeedback
member.summary: Indicates a temperature fault in the amp. EventIds: TemperatureFaultFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.
member.remarks: True = Temperature fault; False = No fault

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.C2nAmp.VoltageFaultFeedback
member.summary: Indicates the status of Voltage fault. EventIds: VoltageFaultFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.
member.remarks: True = Voltage fault; False = No fault.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.C2nAmp.FrontPanelSwitchOnFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the amplifier is turned on (front panel power switch is set to the On position). Turning the power switch off will reset the amplifier any faults) and set all sources to zero. When the amplifier is turned off the unit will not respond to join changes. EventIds: FrontPanelSwitchOnFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.
member.remarks: True = Power switch is On; False = Power switch is Off.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.C2nAmp.TemperatureFeedback
member.summary: When temperature reporting is enabled (TemperatureReportingEnableFeedback = true)reports the internal amplifier temperature. The temperature is reported in degrees Fahrenheit when TemperatureFormat = low, and in degrees Celsius when TemperatureFormat = true. Reported values will range from 25°C to 125°C (77°F to 257°F). EventIds: TemperatureFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Swamp.AllZonesDoorbellAudioOnFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the doorbell source is selected for all doorbell enabled zones as long as the property is true. A false indicates that normal source is selected for all doorbell enabled zones
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Swamp.MuteAllZonesFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates the mute state of all zones from the and connected Expanders that have sources routed. When true, all zones with sources routed are muted. When false, at least one of the zones with routed sources is not muted, or all zones are off.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Swamp.FrontPanelLockedFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates the lock status of the front panel. The output is true for as long as the buttons are locked out; when false, this indicates that the front panel is not locked.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Swamp.TemperatureFormatFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates the temperature format. The output is true for as long as the format is set to Celsius. When the output is false, this indicates that the format is set to Fahrenheit.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.CnAmpxXBase.EnableRoomAudio
member.summary:
Property to return the collection which can enables audio to the corresponding room.
Set 'True' to corresponding collection index to enable audio. Set 'False' to corresponding collection index to disable audio.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.CnAmpxXBase.RoomAmpFaultFeedback
member.summary:
Property that return the collection that indicates an over-current or temperature fault in the corresponding room.
When a fault occurs, all audio to the amplifier is cut and the unit will attempt to reset after a short period.
If the reset fails the problem must be resolved manually before audio can be restored.
Get 'True' to corresponding collection index to if Amp fault is there, else 'False'.
The event will trigger with and gives the index into the collection.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.CnAmpxXBase.RoomWireFaultFeedback
member.summary:
Property that return the collection that a fault in the wires or cables of the corresponding amplifier.
When a fault occurs, all audio to the amplifier is cut and the CNAMPX unit will attempt to reset after a short period.
If the reset fails the problem must be resolved manually before audio can be restored.
Get 'True' to corresponding collection index to if Wire fault is there, else 'False'.
The event will trigger with and gives the index into the collection.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.CnAmpxXBase.RoomToMonitor
member.summary:
Property to select the room to be monitored via the and outputs.
Valid analog values are defined in enum .
member.exception: Value passed for audio source is not defined in the enum .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.CnAmpxXBase.LeftSigLevelFeedback
member.summary:
Property that reports the samples and displays the left audio levels for the room defined by .
The levels are updated intermittently, not continuously, and thus are not suitable for real-time display of audio levels.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.CnAmpxXBase.RightSigLevelFeedback
member.summary:
Property that reports the samples and displays the right audio levels for the room defined by .
The levels are updated intermittently, not continuously, and thus are not suitable for real-time display of audio levels.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Zone.LoudnessOn
member.summary: Method to enable zone's loudness function. When loudness is active, this adds a bass gain of +10dB and a treble gain of +5dB.

member.summary: Method to disable the zone's loudness function.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Zone.CrestronDRCOn
member.summary: Applies the Crestron-defined DRC (Dynamic Range Control) algorithm to the zone's audio. Dynamic range control reduces loud peaks in sound while raising the level of quiet sounds.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Zone.CrestronDRCOff
member.summary: Disables the Crestron-defined DRC (Dynamic Range Control) algorithm to the zone's audio.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Zone.DoorbellEnableOff
member.summary: Method to disable the doorbell mode for this zone. This is supported in device firmware versions 4.002.278600000 and higher

member.summary: This Number of the .

member.summary: Indicates if the Zone is Amplified or not.

member.summary: Select the source to switch to a particular zone, where 1 to 24 are valid for Analog and SPDIF sources.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Zone.Volume
member.summary: Sets the Zone volume level.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Zone.MinVolume
member.summary: Defines the minimum volume. This allows endpoints to be set for volume control.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Zone.MaxVolume
member.summary: Defines the maximum volume. This allows endpoints to be set for volume control.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Zone.StartupVolume
member.summary: Sets the startup volume. This is the default volume that will be applied as the switcher transitions from no source selected (0) to a source being routed (1-24).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Zone.Bass
member.summary: Sets the bass level. Valid values range from -120 (-12dB) to +120 (+12dB), where 1 = 0.1dB.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Zone.Treble
member.summary: Sets the treble level. Valid values range from -120 (-12dB) to +120 (+12dB), where 1 = 0.1dB.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Zone.Balance
member.summary: Sets the audio balance. Valid values range from -50% to +50%. A value of 0% signifies an even balance between left and right.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Zone.EQSelection
member.summary: Sets the tone profile, which sets the bass and treble to pre-defined levels.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Zone.OutputBusVolumeOffset
member.summary: Sets the volume offset. The offset ranges from -120 (-12dB) to +120 (+12dB), where 1 = 0.1dB.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Zone.DoorbellVolume
member.summary: Sets the doorbell volume level. Use "SimplSharpDeviceHelper.PercentToUshort" to convert the percentage to a ushort value or "SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UshortToPercent" to convert the ushort value to percentage. This is supported in device firmware versions 4.002.278600000 and higher.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Zone.Name

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.AmplifiedZone.OverCurrentFeedback

member.summary: Sets the Room volume level.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.MinimumVolume
member.summary: Defines the minimum volume. This allows endpoints to be set for volume control.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.MaximumVolume
member.summary: Defines the maximum volume. This allows endpoints to be set for volume control.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.StartupVolume
member.summary: Sets the start up volume.This is the default volume that will be applied as the switcher transitions from no source selected (0) to a source being routed (1-12).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.Bass
member.summary: Sets the bass level.Valid values range from -120 (-12dB) to +120 (+12dB), where 1 = 0.1dB.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.Treble
member.summary: Sets the treble level.Valid values range from -120 (-12dB) to +120 (+12dB), where 1 = 0.1dB.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.Balance
member.summary: Sets the audio balance. Valid values range from -50% to +50%. A value of 0% signifies an even balance between left and right. Use to convert the percentage to a UShort value or to convert the UShort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.Name
member.summary: Sets the Room name. The string can consist of alphanumeric characters (20 characters max).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.OnFeedback
member.summary: Indicates the current Room Status. The property value is true when room is active. When false, this indicates room is off. This is valid only for Amplified Rooms. EventIds: OnFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.MuteOnFeedback
member.summary: Indicates the current mute status. The property value is true when mute is active. When false, this indicates audio has resumed. EventIds: MuteOnFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.MonoOnFeedback
member.summary: Indicates the mono status of the room. The property value is true when room audio is set to mono. When false, this indicates stereo. EventIds: MonoOnFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.LoudnessOnFeedback
member.summary: Indicates the status of the loudness function. The property value is true when loudness is on. When false, this indicates that loudness is off. EventIds: LoudnessOnFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.DcFaultFeedback
member.summary: Indicates the Dc Fault status of the Room. The property value is true when there is DC fault. When false, this indicates no fault. This is valid only for Amplified Rooms. EventIds: DcFaultFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.OverCurrentFaultFeedback
member.summary: Indicates the Over Current Fault status of the Room. The property value is true when there is Over Current fault.When false, this indicates no fault. This is valid only for Amplified Rooms. EventIds: OverCurrentFaultFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.SourceFeedback
member.summary: Reports the currently active source. EventIds: SourceFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.VolumeFeedback
member.summary: Reports the volume level. EventIds: VolumeFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.VolumeDbFeedback
member.summary: Reports the actual volume level in decibels. Reported values will range from -800 (-80dB) to +200 (+20dB), where 1 = 0.1dB. EventIds: VolumeDbFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.MinimumVolumeFeedback
member.summary: Reports the Min volume. EventIds: MinimumVolumeFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.MaximumVolumeFeedback
member.summary: Reports the Max volume. EventIds: MaximumVolumeFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.StartupVolumeFeedback
member.summary: Reports the start up volume. EventIds: StartupVolumeFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.BassFeedback
member.summary: Tracks the value of the corresponding bass. EventIds: BassFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.TrebleFeedback
member.summary: Tracks the value of the treble. EventIds: TrebleFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.Room.BalanceFeedback
member.summary: Reports the audio balance. EventIds: BalanceFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.

member.summary: Reports the Room name. The string can consist of alphanumeric characters (20 characters max). EventIds: NameFeedbackEventId will trigger to indicate change.

member.summary: The C2NAMP6x100 is a Ethernet supported 6 stereo room power amplifier with 12 stereo lines designed for residential applications.The unit supports bridging 1+2, 3+4 and 5+6 to feed higher power speakers.Additionally, the C2N-AMP-6X100 also includes two fully-independent auxiliary which enable support for 2 additional rooms.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.RoomCnxPad.MuteOn
member.summary:
Property to mute audio to the corresponding room for as long as the input is high.
When the input goes low, audio resumes.
'true' means Mute audio and 'false' means Resume audio.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.RoomCnxPad.RoomOn
member.summary:
Property to enable audio to the corresponding room for as long as the input is high.
When the input goes low, audio to the room is disabled.
'true' means Enable audio and 'false' means Disable audio.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.RoomCnxPad.EnableLoudness
member.summary:
Property to activate the loudness function for the corresponding room for as long as the input is high.
Loudness boosts low and high frequency signals at low volume levels.
'true' means Loudness on and 'false' means Loudness off.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.RoomCnxPad.MonoMode
member.summary:
Property to change the audio setting in the corresponding room from stereo to mono mode for as long as the input is high.
'true means 'Mono' and 'false' means Stereo.
This property is not supported on "CNX-PAD8".

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.RoomCnxPad.AudioSourceForRoom
member.summary: Property to select the audio source to be switched to the corresponding room.
member.para: Values ranged from till are supported only in .
member.exception: Value passed for audio source is not defined in the enum .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.RoomCnxPad.Volume
member.summary:
Property to set the volume level of the corresponding room.
Valid values range from 0% (-80dB) to 100% (+20dB).
Use to convert the percentage
to a UShort value or to convert the UShort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.RoomCnxPad.Balance
member.summary:
Property to set the balance between the left and right speakers in the corresponding room, relative to 50%.
That is, a value of 50% indicates even distribution between the left and right speakers; 0% equals full left, while 100% equals full right.
The input defaults to 0% (full left), and thus should not be left undefined, as this could lead to undesirable results.
Use to convert the percentage
to a UShort value or to convert the UShort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.RoomCnxPad.Bass
member.summary:
Property to set bass level in the corresponding room relative to 50%. That is, a value of 50% signifies a flat bass level corresponding to 0dB.
Valid values range from 0% (-12dB) to 100% (+12dB), adjustable in 2.0dB steps (1% = 2.0dB). The bass is applied equally to the left and right channels.
The input defaults to 0%, and thus should not be left undefined, as this could lead to undesirable results.
Use to convert the percentage
to a UShort value or to convert the UShort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.RoomCnxPad.Treble
member.summary:
Property to set treble level in the corresponding room relative to 50%. That is, a value of 50% signifies a flat treble level corresponding to 0dB.
Valid values range from 0% (-12dB) to 100% (+12dB), adjustable in 2.0dB steps (1% = 2.0dB). The treble is applied equally to the left and right channels.
The input defaults to 0%, and thus should not be left undefined, as this could lead to undesirable results.
Use to convert the percentage
to a UShort value or to convert the UShort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.RoomCnxPad.MinimumVolume
member.summary:
Property that defines the minimum volume gain as a percentage from 0% to 100%.
The and inputs allow endpoints to be set for volume control.
For instance, if = 30% and = 80%, the volume signal would then adjust over a range of -50dB to 0dB.
Use to convert the percentage
to a UShort value or to convert the UShort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.AudioDistribution.RoomCnxPad.MaximumVolume
member.summary:
Property that defines the maxmum volume gain as a percentage from 0% to 100%.
The and inputs allow endpoints to be set for volume control.
For instance, if = 30% and = 80%, the volume signal would then adjust over a range of -50dB to 0dB.
Use to convert the percentage
to a UShort value or to convert the UShort value to percentage.
